title: Trump Putin Meet | Trump-Putin To Meet On Aug 15; Trump Exerts Pressure On Big Tech
Stocks Waver Ahead of Busy Week of Data, Trump-Putin Meeting | Bloomberg Brief 8/11/2025
summary: US equity futures edge slightly higher as investors head into a week full of key economic data. Oil reverses earlier declines as Presidents Trump and Putin are set to meet on Friday to discuss ending the war in Ukraine.
fullContent: US equity futures edge slightly higher as investors head into a week full of key economic data. Oil reverses earlier declines as Presidents Trump and Putin are set to meet on Friday to discuss ending the war in Ukraine. Gold futures in New York fall as traders seek clarification from the White House over its surprise tariff policy last week. Nvidia and AMD agree to pay the US government 15% of their revenues from Chinese AI chip sales. Ella Hoxha of Newton Investment Management says the current complacency in markets will likely be tested in the second half of the year. Lauren Saidel-Baker of ITR Economics discusses her outlook for US data. ‚ÄúBloomberg Brief‚Äù delivers the market news, data and analysis you need to set your agenda. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: India Is Winning the Fight Against Poverty
summary: India has managed to lift 302 million people out of poverty over the past 12 years, thanks to rapid economic growth and targeted welfare policies. The sharpest declines in poverty rates have been among Muslims and other marginalized communities, suggesting that the benefits of...
fullContent: India has managed to lift 302 million people out of poverty over the past 12 years, thanks to rapid economic growth and targeted welfare policies. The sharpest declines in poverty rates have been among Muslims and other marginalized communities, suggesting that the benefits of growth have been broadly shared.

title: Sitharaman introduces Taxation Laws (Amendment) Bill in Lok Sabha
summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman introduced the Taxation Laws (Amendment) Bill, 2025 in the Lok Sabha on Monday. The bill proposes tax exemptions for subscribers of the Unified Pension Scheme (UPS), aligning its benefits with the New Pension Scheme (NPS).
fullContent: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman introduced the Taxation Laws (Amendment) Bill, 2025 in the Lok Sabha on Monday. The bill proposes tax exemptions for subscribers of the Unified Pension Scheme (UPS), aligning its benefits with the New Pension Scheme (NPS). It also includes modifications to income tax search case assessments and offers direct tax benefits to Saudi Arabian public investment funds.

title: The Market Game Is Rigged And Everyone Is Lying... Still
summary: The Market Game Is Rigged And Everyone Is Lying... Still Submitted by QTR's Fringe Finance I just sat down with Dan Ferris on Stansberry‚Äôs Investor Hour for one of the most honest, wide-ranging interviews I‚Äôve done in a while.
fullContent: The Market Game Is Rigged And Everyone Is Lying... Still Submitted by QTR's Fringe Finance I just sat down with Dan Ferris on Stansberry‚Äôs Investor Hour for one of the most honest, wide-ranging interviews I‚Äôve done in a while. Before this conversation hits the wider world, I wanted to make it available first to you ‚Äî my paid subscribers. It pulls from years of experience, harsh lessons, and truths that don‚Äôt get spoken on CNBC or passed around in TikTok trading rooms. I started the conversation with a little self-deprecating humor, pointing out that I thought my ‚Äúhalf-life with ever being invited back to anything Stansberry after my 2019 onstage performance in Las Vegas was much longer than six years.‚Äù I told the story of how I showed up from the pool in a tank top for that event and how ‚ÄúI‚Äôm just going to go and say what I want to say. And that‚Äôs going to be it. And if I don‚Äôt get invited back, you know, that‚Äôs okay.‚Äù My philosophy is simple‚Äîsay what I want, enjoy myself, and if people get flustered over salty language, so be it. When we got into the subject of tariffs and manufacturing, I admitted that while tariffs have downsides, ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think that it‚Äôs a bad idea‚Ä¶ to make this hard stop and say, listen, we have to do something.‚Äù COVID had exposed how much we rely on overseas production for critical items‚Äî‚Äúthe ingredients that are used to make pharmaceuticals, the pharmaceuticals themselves, the rare earth minerals, the things that really‚Ä¶ hang significant portions of our quality of life.‚Äù I pointed out how ‚Äúthe only thing this country exports right now is dollars‚Äù and how trying to reverse decades of decline in domestic manufacturing is ‚Äúlike turning around the f*cking Titanic.‚Äù From there, I laid out what I think is the real danger: how financial markets are structured today. I explained the ‚Äúpassive bid‚Äù problem‚Äîhow ‚Äúpeople are buying the ETF, and that‚Äôs driving Apple higher‚Äù regardless of fundamentals. I said the danger is that when redemptions spike, ‚Äúa lot of these funds don‚Äôt have cash liquid to absorb those redemptions‚Äù and instead ‚Äúhave‚Ä¶ taken on leverage specifically so they don‚Äôt have to sell.‚Äù With 40% of S&P index money in just 10 stocks, ‚Äúwe‚Äôre really in a situation where we‚Äôre putting so many of our eggs all in seven baskets. And that‚Äôs frightening.‚Äù I also talked about the options market, which I see as one of ‚Äútwo giant f*cking trap doors underneath the market.‚Äù When dealers sell calls or puts, ‚Äúthere‚Äôs a certain percentage‚Ä¶ they have to hedge against,‚Äù which can force huge amounts of buying during manias like GameStop. I said, ‚ÄúThe entire market has become leveraged gambling. I mean, top to bottom.‚Äù The same mechanism can work in reverse, and ‚Äúwhen that happens again, you‚Äôre going to see options weaponized in the other direction, which I think could be extremely dangerous.‚Äù We also got into specific names and the market darlings. I didn‚Äôt hold back on Cathie Wood and ARK Invest. ‚ÄúShe promised 40% compounded returns some years back and ARKK has gone nowhere in comparison‚Äù The gap between the promise and reality is ‚Äújust a little bit off.‚Äù I said bluntly, ‚ÄúThere hasn‚Äôt been a piece of pre-order, pre-revenue dog sh*t that these people haven‚Äôt fallen in love with.‚Äù Without Tesla‚Äôs 10x run from late 2019 to mid-2020, ‚Äúno one ever hears this woman, ever.‚Äù üî• TAKE 65% OFF IF YOU SUBSCRIBE TODAY: Anyone who subscribes annually today, using the below link, IMMEDIATELY gets 65% off full price. This discount lasts for as long as you wish to remain a subscriber: Get 65% off forever That doesn‚Äôt mean I‚Äôm a pessimist. ‚ÄúMost of my portfolio is long, but it‚Äôs just long in stuff that‚Äôs not mag seven sh*t.‚Äù I like value-oriented names like UPS, ‚Äúwhich trades at 12 times earnings, pays a dividend‚Ä¶ a business that‚Äôs going to be here forever.‚Äù I also own ‚Äúgold miners, silver miners‚Ä¶ nuclear‚Ä¶ psychedelics‚Äù and ‚Äúanything I can do to kind of get out of the system as it exists today.‚Äù If you‚Äôre holding insolvent companies or fad coins, ‚Äúthere is no bottom.‚Äù On the macro side, I see the MMT cycle accelerating, ‚Äúwidening the inequality gap,‚Äù and cornering the Fed. Inflation is still above target, so they‚Äôll have to choose between ‚Äúbasically a quick deflationary depression or inflation.‚Äù I described this moment as a transition from ‚Äúthe gold standard to fiat‚Ä¶ [to] fiat to digital‚Äù where ‚Äúeven more rules just kind of fly out the window because we have even more ways to micromanage the money supply.‚Äù I wrapped up by reminding people how quickly things can change. ‚ÄúOne day it‚Äôs not a big issue and then you wake up the next day and people are fist fighting over toilet paper.‚Äù The lesson I‚Äôve learned from a decade of short selling is simple: ‚ÄúEverybody‚Äôs a liar, everybody‚Äôs a fraud. Nothing is as it seems.‚Äù My advice: ‚ÄúBe vigilant about protecting yourself and protecting your‚Ä¶ family and your community‚Äù and remember ‚Äúthe more complacent everybody gets, the more non-complacent you should become.‚Äù (WATCH THE FULL VIDEO INTERVIEW HERE) Tyler Durden Mon, 08/11/2025 - 06:30

title: Stocks Erase Gains as Hope Dims for Ukraine Talks, Nvidia, AMD to Pay US | The Pulse 8/11/2025
summary: Nvidia Corp. and Advanced Micro Devices Inc. agreed to pay 15% of their revenues from Chinese AI chip sales to the US government in a deal to secure export licenses. The arrangement reflects US President Donald Trump‚Äôs effort to engineer a financial payout for America in...
fullContent: Nvidia Corp. and Advanced Micro Devices Inc. agreed to pay 15% of their revenues from Chinese AI chip sales to the US government in a deal to secure export licenses. The arrangement reflects US President Donald Trump‚Äôs effort to engineer a financial payout for America in return for concessions on trade, according to the text. Elsewhere, Stocks erased gains as traders dialed back optimism that a summit between US President Donald Trump and Russia‚Äôs Vladimir Putin would bring the war in Ukraine closer to a resolution. S&P 500 futures were little changed after the index ended Friday just shy of a record high. Europe‚Äôs main equity benchmark was also flat, having earlier risen as much as 0.4%. Brent crude trimmed losses to trade down 0.4% around $66.30 a barrel. Today's guests: Subitha Subramaniam, Sarasin & Partners Investment Strategy Head, Yacov Arnopolin, PIMCO Emerging Markets Portfolio Manager (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Woman arrested after bodies of mother, brother found in Hong Kong flat
summary: Hong Kong police have arrested a woman on suspicion of murder after the bodies of her mother and middle-aged brother were found in a flat in Cheung Sha Wan. The case came to light at around 3.50pm on Monday when authorities received a call that a man, 48, had been found...
fullContent: Hong Kong police have arrested a woman on suspicion of murder after the bodies of her mother and middle-aged brother were found in a flat in Cheung Sha Wan. The case came to light at around 3.50pm on Monday when authorities received a call that a man, 48, had been found unconscious in a flat in the Hang Moon Building on Cheung Sha Wan Road. Firefighters arrived and entered the flat, where they found the bodies of the man and his mother, 85. A police source said the mother had injuries on her...

title: Nvidia-AMD Deal on China Chip Sales, Trump & Putin to Meet in Alaska | The Opening Trade 8/11
summary: Nvidia and AMD agreed to pay 15% of their revenues from Chinese AI chip sales to the US government in a deal to secure export licenses, an unusual arrangement that may unnerve both US companies and Beijing.
fullContent: Nvidia and AMD agreed to pay 15% of their revenues from Chinese AI chip sales to the US government in a deal to secure export licenses, an unusual arrangement that may unnerve both US companies and Beijing. Nvidia plans to share 15% of the revenue from sales of its H20 AI accelerator in China while AMD will deliver the same share from MI308 revenues. Donald Trump plans to meet Russian President Vladimir Putin in Alaska as the US president looks to broker an agreement that will bring an end to the war in Ukraine. Trump wrote Friday in a social media post, ‚ÄúFurther details to follow.‚Äù The Opening Trade has everything you need to know as markets open across Europe. With analysis you won't find anywhere else, we break down the biggest stories of the day and speak to top guests who have skin in the game. Hosted by Kriti Gupta, Guy Johnson and Valerie Tytel. (Source: Bloomberg)
